member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile
member.summary: The DICOMFile class is simply a DICOM Collection with methods to read and write files. This class depends heavily on the DICOMReader class in the EvilDicom.Helper namespace.

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject
member.summary: The DicomCollection class is an abstract class to be inherited by any class that contains a collection of DICOM objects. It contains useful methods for searching a collection of DICOM objects by Tag ID.

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.collection
member.summary: The collection of DICOM objects

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.isLittleEndian
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.AddObject(EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement)
member.summary: Adds a DICOM object to the collection
member.param: the DICOM object to be added

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.Find(System.String)
member.summary: This method searches the dicom file for a particular tag.
member.param: The tag to be searched (eg. "00030000" for 0003,0000)
member.returns: Returns the fist tag found in the dicom file that matches the id input parameter.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.Find(System.String[])
member.summary: This method searches the dicom file using a chain of strings. It is intended to be used to find particular tags deep within the Dicom structure. To use it, simply input a string array containing the descending tags to be searched. The method will return results that match the last tag in the string array if and only if they have parent tags that match the preceeding tags in the string array. A string array then looks like this: new string[]{parent, child A, child B (child of A), clild C (child of B)..etc...,child Final (search taget)}
member.param: string array that contains the descendant selection tags with the target in the last index
member.returns: Returns a list of dicom objects that match the tag search chain

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.WriteBytes(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the byte sequence of this collection in big or little endian encoding, depending on the setting of the isLittleEndian variable.
member.param: a Binary writer used to write the bytes
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.WriteBytes(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the byte sequence of this collection in big or little endian encoding, depending on the setting of the isLittleEndian variable. Only writes the number of objects in the objects to write parameter
member.param: a Binary writer used to write the bytes
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.
Number of objects to write

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMObject.Length
member.summary: The entire byte length of all DICOM objects in the collection added together

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor for the DicomFile object

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The main constructor of the DicomFile object which takes a string path of a DICOM file and parses the file into a collection of accessable DICOM objects which it adds to its collection.
member.param: the string path to the DICOM file

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The main constructor of the DicomFile object which takes a byte[] making up a DICOM file and parses the file into a collection of accessable DICOM objects which it adds to its collection.
member.param: the string path to the DICOM file

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This constructor allows a DICOM file with no preamble. The parameter is set by the hasPreamble input.
member.param: the string path to the DICOM file

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.WriteFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method writes the bytes of a DICOM file which includes the DICOM preamble of 128 null bytes followed by the ASCII characters "DICM".
member.param: the string path indicating where to write the file and the name of the file
a boolean indicating whether or not the bytes are to be written in little or big endian encoding

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.AddObject(EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement)
member.summary: Adds a Dicom object to the DicomObject stack and sorts by tag.
member.param: the Dicom object to be added

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.RemoveObject(EvilDicom.Components.Tag)
member.summary: Removes an object from the DicomObject stack that has the input id
member.param: the tag containing the id to be removed

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.RemoveObject(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an object from the DicomObject stack that has the input id
member.param: the tag id to be removed

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.Path
member.summary: The physical path to the Dicom file

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile.HasBeenParsed
member.summary: Indicates whether or not this file has been parsed into Dicom objects

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement
member.summary: The DICOMObject class contains all the necessary variables and methods of a DICOM object including a Tag, VR (with an encoding type), Byte Data, and a boolean describing the byte encoding.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor for the DICOM object

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.WriteBytes(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A method which writes the bytes of this DICOM object in little or big endian encoding based on the isLittleEndian variable
member.param: the Binary writer for writing the bytes
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.Encode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method is used to check the endian of the Dicom object and arrange the byte data accordingly. This method is normally only called by children of the DICOMObject class and only when it is changing from one endianness to another.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.find(System.String[])
member.summary: This method is defined to be overridden by descendant classes such as the Sequence class. For a normal DICOM object with no internal DICOM Objects, this method returns null.

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.VR
member.summary: The two letter VR type in string format

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.Length
member.summary: An integer representing the length of the entire DICOM object which includes the byte data, length parameter, VR (sometimes explicitly), and Tag ID.

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.EncodeType
member.summary: Describes the encoding type of the VR (Implicit, Explicit, Long Explicit)

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.Tag
member.summary: The Tag which contains the id of this DICOM object

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.ByteData
member.summary: The raw byte data of the DICOM object. It is not very useful without the VR necessary to decode it.

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement.IsSequence
member.summary: A boolean which indicates if this DICOM object is a sequence.

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader
member.summary: A class for reading DICOM files.

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.vrs
member.summary: A string array containing all possible VR types

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.longVrs
member.summary: A string array containg all VR with long explicit encoding

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.IsValidDicom(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: The method checks to see if the DICOM file is valid to begin. All valid DICOM files have the first 128 bits set to null (0x00) This is followed by 4 ASCII characters 'DICM' Returns true if both of these conditions are met.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.ReadTag(System.IO.BinaryReader,EvilDicom.Components.DICOMElement)
member.summary: This method reads the next four bytes of a binary reader object and parses out the DICOM tag. It then sets this tag as the tag for the DicomObject parameter.
member.param: The BinaryReader object that is coming from the DicomFile.
The DicomObject that the tag will be set to.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.ReadTag(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method reads the next four bytes of a binary reader object and parses out the DICOM tag. It then returns this tag.
member.param: The BinaryReader object that is coming from the DicomFile.
The boolean that indicates how the DicomFile was written.
member.returns: A Tag with the correct group and element ids set.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.ReadObject(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method takes a binary reader and parses out the next DICOM object in the sequence of objects.
member.param: the Binary reader containing the DICOM object
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.FindObject(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: This method finds the next Dicom object matching the input tag and returns it. It is faster than parsing the entire Dicom structure with the ReadObject method as it skips objects not matching the criteria.
member.param: the Binary reader containing the DICOM object
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.
the tag of the form "GGGGEEEE" that is being searched where G is group id and E is element id

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.ReadSequenceItem(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method reads and returns the next Sequence Item from a Binary reader object.
member.param: A Binary reader containing the bytes of the sequence item.
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMReader.GetEncoding(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.String@,System.Int32@,EvilDicom.Components.Constants.EncodeType@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method determines the encoding type of the VR of the next DICOM object in a Binary reader.
member.param: The Binary reader containing the bytes of a DICOM object
The two letter representation of the VR of the DICOM object
The lenght of the data in this DICOM object
The encoding type of the VR in this DICOM object
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.ImageHelper.PullProperties(EvilDicom.Components.DICOMFile)
member.summary: This method retrieves the relevant image properties from a DICOM file for rendering the image
member.param: the DICOM file to be processed
member.returns: the image properties of the image

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.ImageHelper.GetPixels(EvilDicom.VR.PixelData,EvilDicom.Image.ImageProperties)
member.summary: Takes each raw pixel value and scales it with the slope and intercept specified in the DICOM header properties.
member.param: the pixel data from the DICOM file
the image properties from the DICOM header

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMWriter

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.DICOMWriter.WriteDicomPreamble(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: This method writes the bytes of the DICOM preamble which consists of 128 null bytes followed byte ASCII characters DIC and M.
member.param: The Binary writer to write the bytes of the preamble

member.summary: This method writes the bytes of the passed in tag to the binary writer

The Tag containing the ID to write
A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

A boolean that indicates whether or not the bytes are written in little or big endian.

member.summary: This method writes the two letter ASCII characters (in byte form) of the passed in VR to the binary writer.

The two letter string VR to write
The encoding type of this VR

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix
member.summary: The image matrix class holds the properties and methods necessary for handling the storage and display of image matrices. The matrix can be either a 2D or 3D image.

member.summary: This constructor takes a single dicom file path and parses out the image properties and the pixel data.
member.param: a string containing the path to the DICOM file to create the matrix

member.summary: This constructor takes a string of dicom file paths and parses out the image properties and the pixel data.
member.param: A string array of all of the paths of the dicom files of the image(s) to load into the matrix

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix.#ctor(System.String[],System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBar,System.Windows.Forms.Label)
member.summary: This constructor takes a string of dicom file paths and parses out the image properties and the pixel data. It also takes a progress bar and progress label for updating a UI.
member.param: A string array of all of the paths of the dicom files of the image(s) to load into the matrix
The progress bar in the UI to be updated
The progress label in the UI to be updated

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix.GetImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is designed to return a 24bit RGB bitmap image from one slice of the cube based on the window and level of the image.
member.param: the integer slice number to be drawn. The first slice is zero.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix.GetPartialMatrix(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the pixels values for just one 2D image in the 3D matrix.
member.param: the slice of the image to return

member.summary: This method checks to see if the rows and columns of this file match the dimensions of the initial set
member.param: the path to the DICOM file
member.returns: boolean representing if this file belongs in the set

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix.Image
member.summary: This contains all of the pixel data as float elements in a one dimensional array.

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix.BitImage
member.summary: This contains the bitmap image for displaying the image matrix with the proper window and level.

member.name: P:EvilDicom.Image.ImageMatrix.Properties
member.summary: The properties of the image file(s).

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Helper.TagHelper
member.summary: This class contains all of the useful tag IDs as static strings so they can be accessed programmatically without having to memorize them all.

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMDictionary
member.summary: The DICOMDictionary class is in charge of managing the definitions in the DICOMDictionary. It has one main method.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Components.DICOMDictionary.LookupTag(EvilDicom.Components.Tag)
member.summary: This method takes a Tag with just the ID attribute and looks it up to see if it is in the DICOM dictionary. If it is, it fills in extra information about that tag including the descriptions of the tag. It returns a string VR type indicating the VR of the tag.
member.param: a Tag with (normally with just the ID attribute non-null) that is to be looked up in the DICOM dictionary
member.returns: a string indication the two letters of the VR type of the submitted Tag

member.param: the array of bytes to be converted
member.returns: a hexadecimal string representing the array of bytes passed in

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.ByteHelper.HexStringToByteArray(System.String)
member.summary: This method converts a hexadecimal string to an array of bytes.
member.param: the hexadecimal string to be converted
member.returns: an array of bytes representing the hexadecimal string passed in

member.summary: The element ID of the tag.

the string of the element id for this tag

member.param: The starting position in the matrix
The unit shift in the x direction
The unit shift int the y direction

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.SequenceHelper.FindEndOfSequence(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will find the index of the reader in which the ending tag delimeter for the sequence ends. It successfully can skip all inner sequence items of indefinite length.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.Helper.SequenceHelper.FindEndOfSequenceItem(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will find the index of the reader in which the ending tag delimeter for the sequence ends. It successfully can skip all inner sequence items of indefinite length.
member.param: the binary reader stream containing the sequence items

member.name: T:EvilDicom.VR.SequenceItem
member.summary: The Sequence Item is the object contained within the Sequence Class. Each Sequence Item holds a list of dicom objects, which can include a Sequence Object.

member.name: M:EvilDicom.VR.SequenceItem.#ctor
member.summary: The Sequence Item does not have a VR as it is just a container to a list of dicom objects. Additionally, the Encode Type is set to Implicit because the encoding is similar to Implicit encoding (eg. the length is written in bytes 4-7 for both length types)

member.name: P:EvilDicom.VR.SequenceItem.Length
member.summary: This length adds the tag to the length of all DICOM objects contained within the sequence item.

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.Constants
member.summary: The Constants class stores all of the Constant values (except for Tag IDs) that might need to be accessed from most DICOM programs.

member.summary: Unique ID that represents an implicit VR with little endian encoding

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.EXPLICIT_VR_LITTLE_ENDIAN
member.summary: Unique ID that represents an explicit VR with little endian encoding

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.EXPLICIT_VR_BIG_ENDIAN
member.summary: Unique ID that represents an explicit VR with big endian encoding

member.summary: Unique ID that represents RLE lossless image encoding

member.summary: Unique ID that represents JPEG Progressive image encoding

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.JPEG_LOSSLESS_14
member.summary: Unique ID that represents JPEG lossless (Process 14) image encoding

member.summary: A four byte array containing the bytes representing indefinite length of a sequence or sequence item.

member.name: F:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.ZERO_LENGTH
member.summary: A four byte array containing the bytes representing zero length.

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.LengthType
member.summary: An enum to distiguish between finite and indefinite types of sequences or sequence items.

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.EncodeType
member.summary: An enum to distinguish between the three types of Value Representation coding. Implicit = no VR specified Explicit_2 = VR specified, 2 byte length Explicit_4 = VR specified, 4 byte length

member.name: T:EvilDicom.Components.Constants.TransferSyntax
member.summary: An enum representing the transfer syntax of a given DICOM file.
